Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the established violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.

• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, an original license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at .

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility The Christ Child House office is located
at 15751 Joy Road, Detroit, MI 48228. Their telephone number is (313) 584-
6077. Normal business hours are from 9:00 AM until 5:00 PM, Monday through
Friday. For after business hours and on the weekend, we can be reached at our
main number. Their website is www.christchildhouse.org.
B. Christ Child Detroit has a large conference room and visiting room that will be
utilize for parenting and sibling visits. There is a kitchen and refrigerator to store
food during the visits. The Foster Care and Licensing Worker will have offices
located in the administrative building down from the Program Manager office. The
Foster Care Program Manager office is located at the end of aisle before you get
to the main conference room. The Foster Care and Licensing files will be in the
Foster Care Program Manager office and the file room across from the supervisor
office. Both locations are locked. Employees will be assigned keys as needed to
fulfill job duties. The site is not handicapped accessible. An alarm system is
installed. Fire extinguishers are located in the building.
C. Program Description CHChrist Child Detroit’s Foster Care
program provides general and specialized care and care to medically fragile
youth. The Christ Child Detroit Foster Care program will provide Children and
Families with services and supports they need to maintain safe, nurturing
relationship intended to last a lifetime. The hope is that while the Children are
growing and healing from their traumatic experiences that their parents are taking
measures and making progress towards remedying the issues that led to removal.
Christ Child Detroit strives to work with the youth, the youth’s biological or legal
Family and siblings or extended Family members toward meeting a goal of
permanency for the Child. The Foster Care program for Children provides
placement and supervision of Children who have been abused and/or neglected
and cannot remain in their Family homes because they would be at risk of further
harm.
D. Christ Child Detroit primary goal is to reunite Families. If reunification is not
possible, promote permanency for the Child (i.e., adoption, guardianship,
permanent placement with a fit and willing relative (PPFWR) or another planned
permanent living arrangement (APPLA). When Families cannot be reunified,
Children must be prepared for safe, appropriate permanent placements. A
placement is considered permanent if it is intended to last until the Child reaches
adulthood.
